DataElement.preferredName: FACIT-TS-G Version 1 TS4 Feel Treatment was Right Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of whether or not they feel their treatment was right for them and to what extent, using a 4 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: FACIT-TS-G Feel Treatment was Right Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient-reported outcome measure designed specifically to evaluate general satisfaction with treatment._A question about whether an individual feels or felt that the treatment they received was right for them._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy-Treatment Satisfaction-General
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A patient-reported outcome measure designed specifically to evaluate general satisfaction with treatment.

ValueDomain.preferredName: FACIT Indicator Extent Score 4 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard with values ranging from 0 (No, not at all) to 3 (Yes, completely) used in FACIT questionnaires.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.: An indication that something has been mostly accomplished or has been mostly satisfying.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
An indication that something has been mostly accomplished or has been mostly satisfying.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.: An indication that something has been accomplished to some degree or has resulted in some amount of satisfaction.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
An indication that something has been accomplished to some degree or has resulted in some amount of satisfaction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: A subjective answer of non-agreement.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Do you feel you received the
ReferenceDocuments.description: Do you feel you received the treatment that was right for you?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Materials Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are accessible after registration on the FACIT website.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.
